member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.Libraries.Finance.Trading.Indicators.Volume
member.summary: Within this class we define the indicators which in one way or another describe the effect of the trading volume of the security being considered.

remarks.h3: One Period and Multi Period Versions
remarks.p: For many of the indicators we provide essentially two versions of the same method. The first version evaluates the indicator over the entire period given and the second version evaluates the indicator over all the sub-periods of a given length. Moreover, the version which evaluates over all sub-periods of a given length will return the results as an array where the 1st term of the array will be the value associated with the most resent sub-period, and the previous element corresponding to the previous sub-period and so on.

The naming of these two versions will follow the convention that if the indicator which evaluates over the entire period and returns a single element is named ABCIndicator, then the corresponding indicator over all sub-periods (of a given length) which returns an array will be denoted by ABCIndicatorOverPeriod.

For example, if our source data has N elements then the two versions of a given indicator, where the number of periods used within the sub-periods is n would correspond to:
ABCIndicator - Evaluation the indicator over the whole period of length N.
ABCIndicatorOverPeriod - Will return an array where the first term is the value of the indicator ABCIndicator on the most recent n periods, and the next term is the value of the indicator ABCIndicator on the previous n+1 periods minus the most recent period and so on. That is, for each iterative evaluation `the window of evaluation' is shifted one place back.

member.name: M:dotnetCHARTING.Libraries.Finance.Trading.Indicators.Volume.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.name: M:dotnetCHARTING.Libraries.Finance.Trading.Indicators.Volume.NegativeVolumeIndex(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Implements the Negative Volume Index (NVI) as introduced by Norman Fosback.

remarks.p:
The procedure used for the evaluation of this indicator is as follows:
For any period where the volume is less then the previous periods volume the NVI is evaluated using the formula:
NVI = (Previous Periods NVI) + (((Close - (Previous Close))/(Previous Close)) * (Previous NVI))
If the volume is greater than or equal to the previous periods volume then:
NVI = Yesterday's NVI

member.param: An array of the trading closing prices over the last n-periods where the k-th terms of the array if the closing price on the k-th previous period.
An array of the trading volumes over the last n-periods where the k-th terms of the array if the trading volume on the k-th previous period.
member.exception: Thrown if either parameter is strictly negative or arrays closes or volumes are empty.
member.returns: Returns an array where the first element will be a value of the most recent period considered, and the second element will be the value of the previous period and so on.

member.name: M:dotnetCHARTING.Libraries.Finance.Trading.Indicators.Volume.PositiveVolumeIndex(System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Implements the Positive Volume Index (PVI) as introduced by Norman Fosback.

remarks.p:
The procedure used for the evaluation of this indicator is as follows:
For any period where the volume is greater than the previous periods volume the PVI is evaluated using the formula:
PVI = (Previous Periods PVI) + (((Close - Previous Close)/(Previous Close)) * Previous PVI)
If the present periods volume is less than or equal to the previous periods volume then we have:
PVI = Previous Periods PVI

member.param: An array of the trading closing prices over the last n-periods where the k-th terms of the array if the closing price on the k-th previous period.
An array of the trading volumes over the last n-periods where the k-th terms of the array if the trading volume on the k-th previous period.
member.exception: Thrown if either parameter is strictly negative or arrays closes or volumes are empty.
member.returns: Returns an array where the first element will be a value of the most recent period considered, and the second element will be the value of the previous period and so on.

member.name: M:dotnetCHARTING.Libraries.Finance.Trading.Indicators.Volume.OnBalanceVolume(System.Double[])
member.summary: Implements the On Balance Volume (OBV) indicator which was introduced by Joe Granville within this book New Strategy of Daily Stock Market Timing for Maximum Profits.
member.remarks:
The indicator relates the volume to changes in the price and rests on the assumption that OBV changes precede price changes.
Evaluation Procedure
The OBV indicator is evaluated in accordance with the following rules:
If the present periods closing price is greater than the previous periods close then:
OBV = Previous OBV + Present Volume
If the present periods closing price is less than the previous periods close then:
OBV = Previous periods OBV - Present Volume
If the present periods closing price is equal to the previous close then:
OBV = Yesterday's OBV
member.param: An array of the trading volumes over the last n-periods where the k-th terms of the array if the trading volume on the k-th previous period.
member.exception: Thrown if either parameter is strictly negative or arrays volumes is empty.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.LimitPrimarySeries
member.summary: In a multiple series chart, this property controls the primary series used for the Limit operation. Other series' elements will be matched with the primary series elements and that order will be maintained regardless of the values of the other series. For example, if you limit to the top 5 values and set the LimitPrimarySeries to the sales series other series such as dollar amount or quantity would not affect which elements were ultimately selected for the chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets a string which automatically sets multiple margins as a shortcut.
member.remarks: Controls the margins or amount of space in pixels that will be left around the charting elements including the Legend and title box. This property can be used in conjunction with the Chart.Background property to easily implement attractive custom borders or just pad the chart as you please. The property accepts margins "Left, Top, Right, Bottom" in pixels.

example.code: Chart.Margin = "10"; //set all 4 Margins to 10 Chart.Margin = "10,20"; // set MarginLeft and MarginRight to 10 and MarginTop and Bottom to 20 Chart.Margin = "5,10,15"; // set MarginLeft to 5, MarginTop to 10 and MarginRight to 15 Chart.Margin = "5,10,15,20"; // set MarginLeft to 5, MarginTop to 10, MarginRight to 15 and MarginBottom to 20

Chart.Margin = "10" 'set all 4 Margins to 10 Chart.Margin = "10,20" 'set MarginLeft and MarginRight to 10 and MarginTop and Bottom to 20 Chart.Margin = "5,10,15" 'set MarginLeft to 5, MarginTop to 10 and MarginRight to 15 Chart.Margin = "5,10,15,20" 'set MarginLeft to 5, MarginTop to 10, MarginRight to 15 and MarginBottom to 20

example.code:
Chart.LegendBox.Background = new Background(System.Drawing.Color.SkyBlue) Chart.LegendBox.CornerBottomLeft = BoxCorner.Square Chart.LegendBox.CornerBottomRight = BoxCorner.Square Chart.LegendBox.CornerTopLeft = BoxCorner.Square Chart.LegendBox.CornerTopRight = BoxCorner.Cut Chart.LegendBox.IconPath="icon.gif" Chart.LegendBox.Label = new dotnetCHARTING.Label("",new Font("Arial",10),Color.DarkSlateBlue) Chart.LegendBox.Line = new Line(Color.Blue) Chart.LegendBox.Position = LegendBoxPosition.Top

Notes
- To hide the title box use Chart.TitleBox.Position = TitleBoxPosition.None.
- Setting Chart.TitleBox.Icon = "...IconPath..." draws the image inside the title box.

Chart.TitleBox.Background = new Background(System.Drawing.Color.SkyBlue) Chart.TitleBox.CornerBottomLeft = BoxCorner.Square Chart.TitleBox.CornerBottomRight = BoxCorner.Square Chart.TitleBox.CornerTopLeft = BoxCorner.Cut Chart.TitleBox.CornerTopRight = BoxCorner.Cut Chart.TitleBox.IconPath="icon.gif" Chart.TitleBox.Label = new dotnetCHARTING.Label("Orders By Customers",new Font("Arial",10),Color.DarkSlateBlue) Chart.TitleBox.Line = new Line(Color.Blue) Chart.TitleBox.Position = TitleBoxPosition.Center Chart.TitleBox.Shadow.Color = Color.LightBlue Chart.TitleBox.Shadow.Depth=40

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.UseFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the generated image is saved as a file in the folder or streamed directly to the browser.
member.remarks:
.netCHARTING supports streaming images in addition to returning a reference to a generated file. There are differences in the way the control can be used between these two image return methods. When using a file reference, you are free to treat the page as you normally would, including HTML and any other web content on the page.
If you are streaming the image back, only the control call should exist on the page because no other HTML will render. This is not a limitation of .netCHARTING but rather specific to the HTTP implementation which serves each request separately (as such a request to a web site with 3 images is actually 4 unique requests and the browser does the job of assembling those 4 items into the web page you see.
Becauase streaming images does not allow HTML, setting url and tooltip properties of elements on the chart will have no effect.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.ShowDateInTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which indicates whether specified dates are shown in the title.
member.remarks: Applicable when Chart.DefaultSeries.Start/EndDate or Chart.Series.Start/EndDate are set.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.CalculateEmptyElement
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the values of empty elements are percieved as 0 or omitted in calculations performed with the Chart.SeriesCollection.Add(Calculation calc) shortcut.
member.remarks: If this property is set to false, in all calculations (average,min,median,mode etc.) only the applicable elements are counted. If set to true, such elements are given 0 values and included in the calculation. This case occurs when you have multiple series and are calculating derived series from them. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.CleanupPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minutes images are stored in the folder before they are deleted.
member.remarks:
When .netCHARTING renders a chart a temporary file is created in the directory set by the TempDirectory property. The CleanUpPeriod property determines how frequently (in minutes) this directory is cleaned by deleting old temporary files. The default is 15 minutes and the property can be set to 0 in order to disable the cleanup in which case temp files are not automatically deleted.
Any files that start with 'dnc-' will be deleted in the temp directory.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.CleanupMinimumAge
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of minutes images are stored in the before they are deleted.
member.remarks: When .netCHARTING renders a chart a temporary file is created in the directory set by the TempDirectory property. The CleanupMinimumAge ensures that only files older than this age, in minutes, will be deleted.

example.code: //delete all temp files older than 10 minutes Chart.CleanupMinimumAge = 10;
'delete all temp files older than 10 minutes Chart.CleanupMinimumAge = 10

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.CacheDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minutes an image is cached and displayed on a page before a new one is generated.
member.remarks: When set, a given chart image will be generated on the first hit and on all subsequent hits within the cache duration period the same image will be returned with no rendering work by the chart control.

example.code: //Used the already generated image for upto 45 minutes. Chart.CacheDuration = 45;
'Used the already generated image for upto 45 minutes. Chart.CacheDuration = 45

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.ReloadPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that determines how often the page containing this chart will automatically reload.

example.code: //Reload the page each one minute Chart.ReloadPeriod = new TimeSpan(0,1,0)
'Reload the page each one minute Chart.ReloadPeriod = new TimeSpan(0,1,0)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.DataGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets the control ID of a datagrid control that will be populated with the charted data.
member.remarks: This property accepts a control ID for a datagrid. If set, the data represented in the chart is populated in the datagrid of the same name. You must also define a datagrid control with an appropriately named ID within the same script. This property is useful when displaying tabular chart data along with your charts.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.PieLabelMode
member.summary: See DefaultSeries.DefaultElement.SmartLabel.PieLabelMode.

example.code: //Dispalys label inside the pie slice. Chart.PieLabelMode = PieLabelMode.Inside;

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.DrillDownChain

summary.para: Gets or sets the drill down chain which activates automatic time based drill down if date grouping used.
If Limit or SplitByLimit used with ShowOther option, setting drill down chain to "Other" or "OtherAll" activates automatic drill down to other elements or series.

"OtherAll" shows all other elements or series in the second level.
"Other" shows the next number of elements or series has been set in limit or splitByLimit propertes.

member.remarks: When using automated drill down with , this property controls the drill down chain, or hierarchy, that is followed. In addition you can override names to be displayed for the different drill down levels.

example.para: This samples demonstrate drill down with dategrouping.
For complete drill down samples see Features/Drilldown samples.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.EmptyElementText
member.summary: Gets or sets the default text of empty element labels. See Chart.DefaultSeries.DefaultElement.SmartLabel

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.AlternateText
member.summary: Gets or sets text displayed in place of a chart when images can't be viewed. This property can also be used as a tooltip for the chart in browsers that support this feature.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.DateGrouping
member.summary: Gets or sets a enumeration which determines how the values of a given series are aggregated by date when retrieved from a database.
member.remarks: Controls how the values of a given series are grouped by date. In order to use this option the first column returned by the SqlStatement must be a date/time. Options include Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Months, Quarters and Years where any StartDate and EndDate can be used and the chart will show all values sequentially. There are additional options for Hour/Minute, Day/Hour, Week/Day, Month/Day, Year/Quarter and Year/Month in these cases there are 2 special considerations 1) only a single day / week / month / or year is charted and 2) if the date range is greater than the period type (e.g. 1 day / 1 week / 1 month / 1 year) values are totalled over that period. There are also shortcuts for the grouping cases of Hour (Hours/Minute), Day (Day/Hour), Week(Week/Day), Month (Month/Day) and Year (Year/Month). See all time interval options. This feature automatically groups multiple data points over a given date range into the specific date grouping you select. When DateGrouping is enabled you must ensure that each series within a given chart returns date/time data for the first column returned by the SqlStatement.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.DefaultSeries

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.DefaultAxis

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Chart.DefaultShadow
member.summary: Gets or sets a shadow object whose properties will trickle to all other objects with shadows.

example.code: Dim shadowObj As Shadow = new Shadow() shadowObj.Color = Color.Blue shadowObj.Depth = 5 shadowObj.Soft =true Chart.DefaultShadow = shadowObj

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.DataEngine.LimitPrimarySeries
member.summary: In a multiple series chart, this property controls the primary series used for the Limit operation. Other series' elements will be matched with the primary series elements and that order will be maintained regardless of the values of the other series. For example, if you limit to the top 5 values and set the LimitPrimarySeries to the sales series other series such as dollar amount or quantity would not affect which elements were ultimately selected for the chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.DataEngine.SqlStatement
member.summary: The SQL statement used to obtain the charting data.

remarks.para: The first column returned is used for the X values, and the second for the Y values. The first also has special handling if dates are returned as the DateGrouping property can be used for intelligent date handling and grouping. The third column is optional and is used only for SplitBy. When a third column is set it is used automatically to create a unique series based on each unique value in this column.

NOTE: All date values in your SQL statements should be wrapped with the pound symbol: #10/25/2002#, regardless if Access or SQL server is used. Also the #StartDate# and #EndDate# tokens can be used in which case the dates set for these properties will be set in place of the tokens before the SqlStatement is executed.
See Getting Started > Tutorials > Queries for more info.

example.code:
de.Series.SqlStatement = "SELECT OrderDate,Total FROM Orders"
'If you are doing a SplitBy you would need another field To correspond To your SplitBy value i.e. de.Series.SqlStatement = "SELECT OrderDate,Total,Customer FROM Orders"

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.DataEngine.StoredProcedure

See Getting Started > Tutorials > Connecting to Data for more info.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.DataEngine.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets the limit number of elements returned for each series when data is generated. Gets or sets the limit number of elements returned for each series when data is generated. This property determines the number of elements to include in the limited return. The limit string can be a number "3" or "2x3". In the second format, the first number determines the group position and the second number is the limit. By setting "2x3" with top limit mode, it only return the second "3" maximum elements.

remarks.para: If DateGrouping is used, limit has no effect. In such a case, %StartDate% and %EndDate% must be used to limit the generated element count.
See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine.

member.seealso: LimitMode Property

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.DataEngine.LimitMode
member.summary: Determine the type of limitation. Default is Top.
member.remarks: This property works in conjunction with Limit or SplitByLimit to determine which elements or series should be included or excluded.
member.seealso: Limit Property

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.DataEngine.SplitByLimit
member.seealso: LimitMode Property
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of series created using SplitBy.

remarks.para: This property works with conjunction of LimitMode property and determines the number of series to include in the return. The limit string can be a number "3" or "2x3". In the second format, the first number determines the group positon and the second number is the limit. By setting "2x3" with top limit mode, it only return the second "3" maximum series.
See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine.

Controls how the values of a given series are grouped by date. In order to use this option the first column returned by the SqlStatement must be a date/time. Options include Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Months, Quarters and Years where any StartDate and EndDate can be used and the chart will show all values sequentially. There are additional options for Hour/Minute, Day/Hour, Week/Day, Month/Day, Year/Quarter and Year/Month in these cases there are 2 special considerations 1) only a single day / week / month / or year is charted and 2) if the date range is greater than the period type (e.g. 1 day / 1 week / 1 month / 1 year) values are totalled over that period. There are also shortcuts for the grouping cases of Hour (Hours/Minute), Day (Day/Hour), Week(Week/Day), Month (Month/Day) and Year (Year/Month). See all time interval options. This feature automatically groups multiple data points over a given date range into the specific date grouping you select. When DateGrouping is enabled you must ensure that each series within a given chart returns date/time data for the first column returned by the SqlStatement.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.Series
member.summary: Encapsulates a group of elements.
member.remarks:
The series represents a group of elements and also:
Provides a mechanism for setting default properties of all elements within it.
Controls all series specific properties such as it's LegendEntry or 2D line dash style (if applicable).
Derives an element based on a Calculation performed on the elements within it.
Provides data manipulation methods such as sorting and trimming of it's elements.
See also:Data Model Tutorial

example.code: Dim pageSize As Integer = 3 Dim totalPage As Integer = Chart.Total / pageSize; If Chart.Total Mod pageSize > 0 Then totalPage = totalPage + 1) End If If totalPage > currentPage Then 'Display "Next" button. End If

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.Element

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets a DataTable, DataSet, DataView, OleDbDataReader, SqlDataReader, IDataReader, XML file name, or an object that implement IEnumerable, ArrayList or HashTable used to generate a SeriesCollection.
member.remarks: When not connecting to a database directly using ConnectionString and SqlStatement, this property can be used to supply objects with data.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.ShowOther
member.summary: This property controls if the additional series not shown due to the use of , or the additional elements not shown due to the use of Limit are aggregated into a single series / element and graphed alongside the top x series / elements.
member.remarks:
See Gettings Started > Tutorials > Data Engine for more info.
The default is false.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.OtherElementText
member.summary: Controls the label used for the aggregated datapoint / series created when using Limit or SplitByLimit and setting ShowOther to true.
member.remarks: See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine for more info.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.SqlStatement
member.summary: The SQL statement used to obtain the charting data.
member.remarks:
The first column returned is used for the X values, and the second for the Y values. The first also has special handling if dates are returned as the DateGrouping property can be used for intelligent date handling and grouping. The third column is optional and is used only for SplitBy. When a third column is set it is used automatically to create a unique series based on each unique value in this column.
NOTE: All date values in your SQL statements should be wrapped with the pound symbol: #10/25/2002#, regardless if Access or SQL server is used. Also the #StartDate# and #EndDate# tokens can be used in which case the dates set for these properties will be set in place of the tokens before the SqlStatement is executed.

example.code:
series.Series.SqlStatement = "SELECT OrderDate,Total FROM Orders"
'If you are doing a SplitBy you would need another field To correspond To your SplitBy value i.e. series.Series.SqlStatement = "SELECT OrderDate,Total,Customer FROM Orders"

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.StoredProcedure
member.summary: This property accepts the name of a stored procedure to be used in place of the property in order to obtain data for the chart.
member.remarks: See the property for details on how the return columns are expected. Stored Procedures also work with parameters, see the method.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.ConnectionString
member.summary: Sets the database connection string used when dynamically obtaining charting data from a SQL statement.
member.remarks: This can be overridden or used in combination with the series level connectionstring. Access, Excel and SQL server are supported and automatically detected based on the connection string specified. See Getting Started > Tutorials > Connecting to data.

example.code:
'This will Set the Access connection String Default For all series. Chart.DefaultSeries.ConnectionString = "c:\chartsample.mdb"
'This will Set the SQL server connection String Default To all series: Chart.DefaultSeries.ConnectionString ="server=server name or IP;uid=username;pwd=password;database=database name"

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.Limit
member.summary: Gets or sets the limit number of elements returned for this series when data is generated.

remarks.para: This property determines the number of elements to include in the limited return in conjuction with LimitMode property. The limit string can be a number "3" or "2x3". In the second format, the first number determines the group positon and the second number is the limit. By setting "2x3" with top limit mode, it only return the second "3" maximum elements.

Note: If DateGrouping is used limit has no effect, you can limit the return with the %StartDate% and %EndDate% in such a case.
See also: Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Engine.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.CommandTimeout

summary.para: Gets or sets the wait time before terminating the attempt to execute a command and generating an error.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.SplitByLimit

remarks.para: This property works with conjunction of LimitMode property and determines the number of series to include in the return. The limit string can be a number "3" or "2x3". In the second format, the first number determines the group positon and the second number is the limit. By setting "2x3" with top limit mode, it only return the second "3" maximum series.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of series created using SplitBy.
member.seealso: LimitMode Property

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.StartDate
member.summary: The starting date used with to query filtered data from a database.

remarks.para: This property affects the date listed in the title when %Chart.ShowDateInTitle% is used, it is also used for the %SqlStatement% property where the #StartDate# token is replaced with the value set to this property.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.EndDate
member.summary: The ending date used with to query filtered data from a database.
member.remarks: This property affects the date listed in the title when %Chart.ShowDateInTitle% is used, it is also used for the %SqlStatement% property where the #EndDate# token is replaced with the value set to this property.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.DataFields

member.remarks:
When programmatically setting a datatable or dataset, certain columns are expected with specific names. This property allows you to control the expected names.
See Getting Started > Tutorials > Data Fields for more info.

member.remarks: This property works in conjunction with Limit or SplitByLimit to determine which elements or series should be included or excluded.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.PaletteName
member.summary:
Gets or sets a Palette boolean which indicates which static palette will be used be the of this series.
Note If used, legend behavior will be different.
member.remarks: When setting this property, each element will get it's own color. Whereas by default, all elements within a series take their color from Series.DefaultElement.Color. When the chart detects that the elements have been individually colored, each element's LegendEntry will replace the single legend entry of the series in the legend box.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.Palette
member.summary:
Gets or sets the palette which will be used be the of this series.
Note If used, legend behavior will be different.
member.remarks: When setting this property, each element will get it's own color. Whereas by default, all elements within a series take their color from Series.DefaultElement.Color. When the chart detects that the elements have been individually colored, each element's LegendEntry will replace the single legend entry of the series in the legend box.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.EmptyElement
member.summary: Gets or sets an EmptyElement object associated with this series.
member.remarks: The properties of this empty element apply to all elements in the collection.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.HatchStylePaletteName
member.summary:
Gets or sets a Palette boolean which indicates which static palette will be used be the of this series.
Note If used, legend behavior will be different.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.HatchStylePalette
member.summary: Gets or sets the hatch style palette used be the of this series.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Series.Background
member.summary: Gets or sets the background object used to fill a gauge face or radar associated with this series.
member.remarks: When using ChartType.Radar (single radar) use Chart.DefaultSeries.Background to control the radar background.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.Element
member.summary: Represents a element object or data point on the chart.
member.remarks:
The Element object contains properties that describe it's value such as YValue, YDateTime, BubbleSize etc.. It also defines defines objects and properties that specify the element's behavior and appearance.
Element properties that don't describe it's value can be set simultaneously for all element in a Series by setting them with Series.DefaultElement.___ For example:(Chart.DefaultSeries.DefaultElement.SmartLabel.Text = "%YValue").
See also:Data Model Tutorial

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Hotspot
member.summary: Gets or sets the Hotspot of this Element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.TakeColorFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets a Series or Element object from which this element's color will be inherited.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.ErrorOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the error offset. The offset represents a range, +/- the value of the offset with respect to the element's %YValue% value or range.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.ErrorPlusOffset
member.summary: Gets of sets the positive error offset. When set, a single %SubValue% is drawn above the element's value.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.ErrorMinusOffset
member.summary: Gets of sets the negative error offset. When set, a single %SubValue% is drawn below the element's value.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.ErrorHighValue
member.summary: Gets of sets the high error value. When set, a single %SubValue% is drawn above the element's value. When %ErrorLowValue% is also set, a range %SubValue% is drawn between the two values.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.ErrorLowValue
member.summary: Gets of sets the low error value. When set, a single %SubValue% is drawn below the element's YValue value or range. When %ErrorHighValue% is also set, a range %SubValue% is drawn between the two values.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.ErrorPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the error offset based on the specified percentage of the element's %YValue% value or range. The offset represents a range, +/- the percentage of the element's %YValue% value or range.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.ErrorPlusPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the positive error offset based on the specified percentage of the element's YValue value or range. When set, a single SubValue is drawn above the element's value. When ErrorMinusPercent is also set, a range SubValue is drawn between the two points.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.ErrorMinusPercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the negative error offset based on the specified percentage of the element's YValue value or range. When set, a single SubValue is drawn below the element's value. When ErrorPlusPercent is also set, a range SubValue is drawn between the two points.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.SubValues
member.summary: Gets a collection of SubValue objects drawn on this Element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.DefaultSubValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a default %dotnetCHARTING.SubValue% object used to propagate its property settings to all SubValue objects in the %SubValues% collection.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.YValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the y value of this element.
member.remarks:
YValue is the main value container for elements. It is used at times when the element's value would not officially be considered the y value such as: pie slice value. Using ChartType.ComboHorizontal the YValue type value corresponds to the x axis because this allows the element to be interchangable between the vertical and horizontal combo chart.
This Element value type is used by all chart types except ChartType.Financial.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.YValueStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial Y value of this element.
member.remarks:
Using ChartType.ComboHorizontal, the YValueStart type value corresponds to the x axis because this allows the element to be interchangable between the vertical and horizontal combo chart.
This Element value type is used by all chart types except ChartType.Financial.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.XValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the X value of this element.
member.remarks: This Element value is used with value x axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.XValueStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial X value of this element.
member.remarks: Not yet implemented.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.XDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the X value of this element.
member.remarks: This Element value is used with value x axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.XDateTimeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial X DateTime value of this element.
member.remarks: Not yet implemented.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.YDateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the Y DateTime value of this element.
member.remarks: Using ChartType.ComboHorizontal the YDateTime value type corresponds to the x axis because this allows the element to be interchangeable between the vertical and horizontal combo chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.YDateTimeStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial Y DateTime value of this element.
member.remarks: Using ChartType.ComboHorizontal the YDateTimeStart value type corresponds to the x axis because this allows the element to be interchangeable between the vertical and horizontal combo chart.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.BubbleSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the bubble size of this element.
member.remarks: This Element value type is used by ChartType.Bubble only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Complete
member.summary: Gets or sets the percent complete value of this element.
member.remarks: This Element value type is used by ChartType.Combo, ComboHorizontal, and ComboSideBySide with Column and Cylinder . Primarily used to create Gantt charts.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Open
member.summary: Gets or sets the financial open price of this element.
member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Close

member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Low
member.summary: Gets or sets the financial low price of this element.
member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets the financial volume of this element.
member.remarks: This element value type is used by ChartType.Financial only.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.XAxisTick
member.summary: Gets or sets an AxisTick object that will placed on the x axis at the position of this element's x value. If the x axis is a category axis, AxisTick will not have any effect.
member.remarks: This value is null by default.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.YAxisTick
member.summary: Gets or sets an AxisTick object that will placed on the y axis at the position of this element's y value. If the x axis is a category axis, AxisTick will not have any effect.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.CustomAttributes
member.summary: Gets a collection of custom attributes associated with this element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets a percent value representing this element's needle length.
member.remarks: Applies to gauge charts.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.HatchStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's hatch style.
member.remarks: Hatch styles are filled using . By default the color is transparent and may need to be specified before the hatch appears.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.HatchColor
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's color.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's color.
member.remarks: This color will also trickle to this element's SmartLabel.Color property, unless specified. When this element instance is the %Series.DefaultElement% of a %Series%, this color will trickle to that series' Line.Color property, unless specified.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.SecondaryColor
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's secondary color.
member.remarks: The secondary color is used with financial series types to indicate that the closing price (%dotnetCHARTING.Element.Close%) is lower than the opening price (%dotnetCHARTING.Element.Open%).
member.seealso: SeriesTypeFinancial Enumeration

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Annotation
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's .
member.remarks: The annotation's position will be the same as this element's position, usless specified. Element tokens can be used by this annotation's text to describe the element.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.SmartLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's .
member.remarks: By default this label is hidden unless is true.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's name.
member.remarks: The name property represents the element on label axes.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.AxisMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's .

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this element's ElementMarker is drawn when the parent object's omits the ElementMarker by default.
member.remarks: Only SeriesTypes: Line (when = false), Spline, and Marker draw ElementMarkers by default.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.Element.LegendEntry
member.summary: Gets or sets this element's .
member.remarks: The legend entry represents this element in the . Most charts types will only show legend entries of series, not individual elements. Changing this behavior to show the element's legend entries is done by setting the series' or properties.

member.name: M:dotnetCHARTING.SubValue.FromPlusMinusOffset(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a SubValue class with a different range offset from an element's Yvalue in both directions. Hence, the resulting range will be the sum of the high and low offset values.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of a SubValue class with a range based on the specified percentage of the related element's Yvalue in both directions. Hence, the resulting range will be twice the specified percentage.

member.name: M:dotnetCHARTING.SubValue.FromPlusMinusPercent(System.Double,System.Double)

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.ScaleBreakStyle
member.summary: Specifies how a scale break is drawn on a chart.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ScaleBreakStyle.None
member.summary: The scale break is not accentuated in any way.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ScaleBreakStyle.ZigZag
member.summary: A gap with a zig zag is drawn at the scale break position.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ScaleBreakStyle.Gap
member.summary: A gap is drawn at the scale break position.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ScaleBreakStyle.Line
member.summary: A line is drawn at the scale break position.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.RadarMode
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the x axis on a circular graph such as radar.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.RadarMode.Spider
member.summary: The x axis tick marks are connected by straight lines resembling a spider web.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.RadarMode.Polar
member.summary: The x axis ticks marks are connected by arcs completing a circle around the chart. Connected data points such as lines will have data points interpolated around the arc.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.TimeScaleLabelMode
member.summary: Specifies the single value time label automation mode.

remarks.para: This feature automates choosing different format strings and axis ticks for particular instances in time. These time instance attributes can be modified through the Axis.TimeLabelAutomationMode property.

(Tutorial) See:
Getting Started / General Tutorials / Axis Tutorials / Axis Ticks / Axis Time Label Automation

member.seealso: TimeLabelAutomationInfo Class
TimeLabelAutomation Property (dotnetCHARTING.Axis)

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TimeScaleLabelMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies no time label automation. Only the Axis.DefaultTick and Axis.FormatString will be used.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TimeScaleLabelMode.Hidden
member.summary: Specifies hidden time label mode. Single value time labels will not be shown.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TimeScaleLabelMode.Dynamic
member.summary: Specifies time instance specific label automation mode. Axis ticks will use a format string and axis tick relevant to the instance in time they represent.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TimeScaleLabelMode.Smart
member.summary: Specifies smart time label automation. Similar to specific except the first tick will indicate the instance in time and take it's default value from the axis default tick.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.TimeScaleLabelRangeMode
member.summary: Specifies the range value time label automation mode.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TimeScaleLabelRangeMode.Default
member.summary: Range time ticks will not be generated unless the time intervals are specified in TimeScaleLabelInfo.RangeIntervals.

summary.para: Range time ticks are generated based on dynamically determined intervals.
If time intervals are specified in TimeScaleLabelInfo.RangeIntervals this mode will behave like Default mode.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.SubValueType
member.summary: Specifies the how a sub value is drawn.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.SubValueType.ErrorBar
member.summary: Draws a traditional error bar. The width of the cap line is determined by SubValue.Line.Length. If not specified it is dynamically determined based on the element size.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.SubValueType.Marker
member.summary: Draws a marker at the value position of the SubValue. Two markers are drawn then the SubValue represents a range.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.SubValueType.Line
member.summary: Same as the error bar except only the cap lines are drawn.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.SynchronizeScaleMode
member.summary: Specifies an axis scale synchronization mode between two or more axes.
member.seealso: Axis Class
ScaleSync Class

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.SynchronizeScaleMode.Origin
member.summary: Synchronizes axes to match the axis origins. The origin is the position on a numeric axis where the value is zero (0). This mode does not apply to time axes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.SynchronizeScaleMode.Full
member.summary: Synchronizes the complete axis scale (high, and low).

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.SynchronizeScaleMode.High
member.summary: Synchronizes the high range values of multiple axes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.SynchronizeScaleMode.Low
member.summary: Synchronizes the low range values of multiple axes.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.ChartAreaLayoutMode
member.summary: Specifies the positioning behavior of multiple chart areas on a single chart image.

summary.para: Specifies that chart areas layout will be based on axis relationships where x axes will be matched before chart areas are added based on y axis relationships.
Specifies that chart areas layout will be based on axis relationships where y axes will be matched before chart areas are added based on x axis relationships.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartAreaLayoutMode.VerticalSmart
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out vertically in a single column and arranged based on x axis relationships.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartAreaLayoutMode.HorizontalSmart
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out horizontally in a single row and arranged based on x axis relationships.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartAreaLayoutMode.Vertical
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out vertically in a single column in the order they were added.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartAreaLayoutMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out horizontally in a single row in the order they were added.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartAreaLayoutMode.Custom
member.summary: Specifies that chart areas will be laid out in a grid matrix based on ChartArea.GridPosition.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType
member.summary: Represents the chart type of a chart.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Combo
member.summary:
The combo chart supports virtually every feature. This chart is capable of being every chart you want it to be based on settings of other objects like series and axes. The x axis is a label axis and the y axis is a value axis.
Element values used
YValue, YValueStart, YDateTime, YDateTimeStart, Complete

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.ComboSideBySide
member.summary:
Each series is drawn side by side. This chart doesn't support stacked axis scales and unclustered columns. The x axis is a label axis and the y axis is a value axis.
Element values used
YValue, YValueStart, YDateTime, YDateTimeStart, Complete

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.ComboHorizontal
member.summary:
This chart supports the bar and cylinder series types. The y axis is a label axis and the x axis is a value axis.
Element values used
YValue, YValueStart, YDateTime, YDateTimeStart, Complete

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Pie
member.summary:
The pie chart draws a single pie where each slice represents a series.
Most applications would use Pies rather than Pie
Element values used
YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Pies
member.summary:
Multiple pies where each pie is a series and each slice is an element (suitable for most applications). Pies may also be drawn as donuts. Most applications would use Pies rather than Pie. Pies does not support Series.Palette.
Element values used
YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Donut
member.summary: See Pie.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Donuts
member.summary: See Pies.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Radar
member.summary:
Draws a single radar. The time scale is not supported by the radar graph.
Element values used
YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Radars
member.summary:
Draws multiple radars where each radar is a series. The time scale is not supported by radar graph.
Element values used
YValue

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Scatter
member.summary:
Draws scattered data. Markers, lines, and splines are supported.
Element values used
YValue, YDateTime, XValue, XDateTime

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Bubble
member.summary: Draws scattered data. Markers, lines, and splines are supported. Data Used: YValue, YDateTime, XValue, XDateTime

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Financial
member.summary:
Only 3 axes exist for this chart, price, volume and x axis. No more axes can be bound to series but you can calculate as many axes as you would like. HLC Charts can be achieved by providing a high, low, and close but leaving open equal double.NaN.
Element values used
Open, High, Low, Close, Volume

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Gantt
member.summary: See ComboHorizontal.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.ChartType.Gauges
member.summary:
Draws a gauge for each series. Each element represents a needle.
Element values used
YValue

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.RadarLabelMode
member.summary: Specifies how tick labels behave on a radar graph.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.RadarLabelMode.None
member.summary: The labels are not visible.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.RadarLabelMode.Normal
member.summary: The labels are drawn horizontally next to the tick mark.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.RadarLabelMode.Angled
member.summary: The labels are angled based on the tick mark angle.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.RadarLabelMode.Inside
member.summary: The label is on the right side of the tick mark and angled to touch the top of the grid. The label will be within the radar grid.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.RadarLabelMode.Outside
member.summary: The label is on the right side of the tick mark and angled to lie on top of the grid. The label will be outside the radar grid.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.Scale
member.summary: Indicates the scale of an axis.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.Scale.Normal
member.summary: The normal scale will always show 0 on the chart.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.Scale.Range
member.summary: The axis will start and end shortly outside the range of element values.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.Scale.Logarithmic
member.summary: Logarithmic axis scale.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.Scale.Time
member.summary: Time axis scale.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.Scale.Stacked
member.summary: Similar to Normal but elements are stacked on top of each other.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.Scale.FullStacked
member.summary: Elements are stacked and each stack is equal to 100%.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.Scale.LogarithmicStacked
member.summary: Similar to Logarithmic but elements are stacked on top of each other.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.TickLabelMode
member.summary: Specifies how tick labels are laid out.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TickLabelMode.Automatic
member.summary: Specifies that the best mode is automatically determined.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TickLabelMode.Angled
member.summary: Specifies that labels are angled. Only applies to x axes.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TickLabelMode.Normal
member.summary: Specifies that labels are drawn horizontally on a single line. If labels will overlap with this setting, they will automatically switch to angled.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TickLabelMode.Wrapped
member.summary: Specifies that labels are drawn wrapping horizontally. If labels will overlap with this setting, they will automatically switch to angled.

member.name: T:dotnetCHARTING.TruncationMode
member.summary: Specifies how to trim characters from a string that exceeds a maximum number of characters.

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TruncationMode.Start
member.summary: The end of a string is removed until the specified number of characters remains. (ABCD..)

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TruncationMode.Middle
member.summary: The start and end of a string is removed until the specified number of characters remains. (..EFGH..)

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TruncationMode.End
member.summary: The start of a string is removed until the specified number of characters remains. (..IJKL)

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TruncationMode.StartEnd
member.summary: The middle of a string is removed until the specified number of characters remains (ABCD..IJKL)

member.name: F:dotnetCHARTING.TruncationMode.None
member.summary: No trimming is performed.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.FileManager.TempDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory where images generated by the control are temporarily stored.
member.remarks: This property takes either an absolute path 'c:/inetpub/wwwroot/app/tmp', a relative path ('tmp', '../tmp',) or when started with '/' a relative path from c:/inetpub/wwwroot/ ('/app/tmp).

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.FileManager.FileQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets Jpg file quality. (Worse quality) 0 - 100 (Best quality)

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.FileManager.ImageFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a Enumeration specifying the image file type.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.FileManager.CachePeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that determines the amount of time an image is cached and displayed on a page before a new one is generated.
member.remarks: When set, a given chart image will be generated on the first hit and on all subsequent hits within the cache duration period, the same image will be returned with no rendering work by the chart control.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.FileManager.CleanupPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that determines the amount of time the folder would be checked for deleting old image files.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.FileManager.CleanupMinimumAge
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that determines the minimum amount of time images are stored in the folder before they are deleted.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.FileManager.FileName
member.summary: Sets the file name to save an image as, or gets the file name of an image that has been saved in the after a chart is generated.
member.remarks: When empty, a random name will be created. In order for the cleanup system to include custom file names they must start with 'dnc-', the mask is: 'dnc-*.*'.

member.name: P:dotnetCHARTING.FileManager.StoreQueryString
member.summary: An extra measure of security. Prevents the query string from being used in the cache file in case the file is found and downloaded by a malitious user.
